question-text: Fill in the blanks with the correct word(s), notation(s), term(s), unit(s), etc., as necessary.

set1.question-item-text: In solid ionic compounds, their ions are held in fixed positions and cannot move, and they cannot conduct __________.
A bondâ€™s polarity is determined by the __________ of two bonded atoms.
A bomb calorimeter is used to measure the energy content of __________.
During the progress of a reaction, an __________ intermediate is known as an activated complex.
If the equilibrium constant is __________ than 1, the equilibrium lies to the right, and there are more products than reactants.
Weak acids are weak __________ that partially ionize only to a limited extent in water.
__________ is primarily used in the production of stainless steel.
The cycling of the __________ chemical species has been altered by human activities.
__________ bombs are weapons with massive destructive power.
Each functional group has a characteristic absorption range of __________.

set2.question-item-text: Most chemical reactions react __________ at a high temperature than at a low temperature.
Cadmium exists as the __________ oxidation state in nature.
The BF<sub>3</sub> molecule, which accepts an __________, behaves as a Lewis acid.
The shape of bromine molecule (Br<sub>2</sub>) is __________,
If the external factors are altered, the system will shift to a __________ state if equilibrium.
__________ ion has brilliant blue colour used as paint, ink, and pigments.
A large protein molecule is one of the types of __________.
Prolonged exposure to __________ gas can cause lung cancer.
In solid ionic compounds, their ions are held in __________ positions and cannot move, and hence they cannot conduct electricity.
The neutralisation reaction is exothermic and the enthalpy change is __________.

set3.question-item-text: Simple cubic unit cell is a cubie cell with an atom in each __________ of the cube.
Plants store chemical energy in __________ formed during photosynthesis.
Reaction that are initiated by light are called __________ reactions.
At __________, the rates of forward and reverse reactions are equal.
Autoionisation of water is a reaction between two water molecules yielding __________ and hydroxide ions.
__________ is used for roofs-flooring and ceiling decoration in buildings.
Radioactive substances include radioactive material, __________, and radioactive waste.
Terylene is resistant to __________ and shrinking.
In general, the ions of transition elements have an electronic configuration of __________.
__________ pollution is caused by the harmful disposal of substances into the environment.

set4.question-item-text: Fullerene, carbon nanotubes, and graphene are only __________ covalent molecules.
__________ is a system that allows energy to enter and exist, but matter can neither be gained or lost.
A catalyst which is in the different phrases of the reactants is __________ catalyst.
__________ can be used to absorb harmful sulphur dioxide released from the power station.
Iron and __________ are essential metals used in modern medicine.
Marine birds play a __________ role in the phosphorus cycle.
Plants store __________ in carbohydrates formed during photosynthesis.
__________ can be used to date the antique materials in archaeology.
Methoxyethane is a colourless __________ at room temperature.
Polymers are either found in nature or produced in a __________.
